subject: Nonlinear Dynamics and Complex Systems
title: Nichtlineare Dynamik und komplexe Systeme 1 (TUM, Module PH2027)
description: Foundations of low-dimensional nonlinear dynamics: stability and bifurcations, self-sustained oscillations, limit cycles and Poincaré maps, routes to deterministic chaos, invariant measures and Lyapunov exponents, with hands-on numerical continuation and phase-space analysis. Workload 150 h (60 h contact), 5 ECTS, winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Krischer, Katharina. Language: EN.

goals.title: Nonlinear Dynamics & Complex Systems – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner understands geometric phase-space methods for nonlinear ODEs, bifurcations, oscillations, routes to chaos, and can use numerical tools to analyze low-dimensional dynamical systems.
goals.titleEn: Nonlinear Dynamics & Complex Systems – Module Overview
goals.descriptionEn: Learner understands geometric phase-space methods for nonlinear ODEs, bifurcations, oscillations, routes to chaos, and can use numerical tools to analyze low-dimensional dynamical systems.

goals.title: Phase Space, Stability & Bifurcations
goals.description: Learner can use geometric phase-space analysis to classify fixed points, assess stability, and describe bifurcations in 1D systems.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can use geometric phase-space analysis to classify fixed points, assess stability, and describe bifurcations in 1D systems.

goals.title: Oscillations & Limit Cycles
goals.description: Learner can analyze oscillations in 2D systems, identify limit cycles, and use Poincaré sections/maps to study their bifurcations.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can analyze oscillations in 2D systems, identify limit cycles, and use Poincaré sections/maps to study their bifurcations.

goals.title: Routes to Chaos & Invariants
goals.description: Learner can explain routes to deterministic chaos, characterize chaotic attractors via invariant measures and dimensions, and compute Lyapunov exponents.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain routes to deterministic chaos, characterize chaotic attractors via invariant measures and dimensions, and compute Lyapunov exponents.

goals.title: Numerical Tools & Continuation
goals.description: Learner can use software for phase-space analysis and perform numerical continuation for 1D/2D bifurcation analysis of coupled ODEs.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can use software for phase-space analysis and perform numerical continuation for 1D/2D bifurcation analysis of coupled ODEs.

goals.title: Interdisciplinary Examples
goals.description: Learner can connect nonlinear dynamics concepts to examples across natural sciences and discuss bistability, oscillations, and chaos in applied contexts.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can connect nonlinear dynamics concepts to examples across natural sciences and discuss bistability, oscillations, and chaos in applied contexts.

titleEn: Nichtlineare Dynamik und komplexe Systeme 1 (TUM, Module PH2027)
descriptionEn: Foundations of low-dimensional nonlinear dynamics: stability and bifurcations, self-sustained oscillations, limit cycles and Poincaré maps, routes to deterministic chaos, invariant measures and Lyapunov exponents, with hands-on numerical continuation and phase-space analysis. Workload 150 h (60 h contact), 5 ECTS, winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Krischer, Katharina. Language: EN.
